I've been doing this routine almost daily since COVID started and when I did the wide legged forward fold today, I felt so strong... I started to do a straight legs up headstand. I knew I could do it, but didn't want to face the tiles if things went wrong, so I grabbed my partner and asked him to spot me. UP I WENT! Not one bit of resistance from my body as I pulled my legs up from the ground; it was finally ready and able to support me and the strength I found in that moment has just sent immense shock-waves of positive energy through every fibre of my being. THANK YOU Juiliana for your amazing routines and your contribution. The way I feel right now and the gift you've given me is absolutely priceless. You are an angel of the world, the yoga community and my household. Namaste <3

I took a yoga class at my gym once and I was absolutely out of my league and a very inflexible beginner. I was turned off by it and how the teacher led the class (too fast, not very encouraging). But this short video gave me the confidence to try again! And so encouraging! I love that you say there's no "perfect" pose, since I am not at my most flexible. Thank you, Adriene! i realised how bad my physical abilities really are when i almost fainted at the end

Does anyone know where I can find a yoga video for actual beginners?
I can't follow half the terminology in this and the exercises are either completely impossible or very poorly explained.
I have no idea what is meant by "integrity" when it comes to breathing and posture. I have no idea what a hip point is. I keep nearly falling over during the warrior pose bit, and there's no mention of balance so I must be doing something wrong but there's no explanation as to what that could be it's just assumed that I will somehow know. The instructions for the downward dog bit are super unclear, "listen to your body" well my legs are far to tight to do this and my arms are telling me they are going to drop me on my face so either I'm doing it wrong or it's a much more advanced pose than is being let on. If I can't walk my hands up on to my thighs during the kneeling bit how am I supposed to move my arms around without falling on my face. At one point she says knit your lower ribcage together, what the actual hell does that mean? I feel like yoga would be really useful as I don't have much flexibility but every "beginners" video I can find seems to need you to be a contortionist. I've been trying for like a month now to get into yoga but instead of feeling relaxed and energised every "beginners" video makes me feel like an unfit idiot. I would love if someone could point me in the direction of a video that is actually useful to people trying to learn and not just someone showing off how bendy they are.

I started exercising yoga two years ago with this clip, and it is still my favorite quick fix, I return often to it and it works like magic! It has helped me a lot to stay afloat during challenging and rough moments. I don't know if Youtube counts these views separate as it should, but I decided, that from now on I will give credit and thank Adriene every time this workout saves my day, and document my progress online ( I owe quite a few dozens of thank yous so far...). So, here it goes...
My Corona belly keeps getting in the way of each position i try, feels like i'm doing a dog with a backpack around my torso...........

A minute into this
She: “move your neck”
Me: “Dang it, I have no neck... there goes my dream of doing yoga” 😑😑
my mind during this entire video: "where is my pelvis"
more men should do this. i'm one of them. helped me recover after corona body, mind and lung damages

If you’re just starting out, I hope this helps. Three years ago, I started the 30 Days...and quit after 8 days. During Covid, I decided to try again and it was just what the doctor ordered. I felt improvements by day 5 and soon found myself in life-giving rhythm. This has been a God-send. I’m in a time of big transition (resigned as pastor, my mom died, launching a coaching business, America in turmoil, etc) but starting each day with Adriene has brought renewal. I feel replenished. I finished the 30 days yesterday and I’m back to start again today. So...take it easy. Don’t worry about perfection. Just prioritize the time, show up, and be present. You’ll get results in body and soul. Peace! :D

An update: I previously mentioned that I'd started " 30 days of Yoga w Adriene" a few years ago and quit after 8 days; then started up during Covid in a year of big loss and transition for me. I'm now finishing my fourth round of 30 days and I'm so happy. It's just how I start every day now -- part of my "morning rituals."  It's one of the "pandemic positives" that are mine to keep.
As Adriene suggests, we're supposed to become our own guide in time so I don't always follow step for step. Sometimes I turn the audio down and freestyle with the video running for inspiration and to help me when I get stuck.
Started this today!! Even with my toddler jumping and running around me -__- lol.

I just completed Day 30, but I wanted to circle back around the Day 1 to offer a testimonial to those of you who are just starting out. I'm the last guy to the toga party-- I mean yoga party. I'm thoroughly middle-aged and congenitally stiff as a dry twig. Thirty days ago, I was nursing a chronic back injury and experiencing a lot of pain from what appeared to be a pinched nerve. Today, not only am I stronger and more flexible, but my back and nerve problems are totally under control. The 30 Day Challenge is a bit like an epic poem. Following its long arc has been a beautiful and moving experience. Thank you.

I spent two days sleeping, crying out loud. And then it hit me. Let’s do day 1 with Adrien again. It’s easy, I don’t have to go out, I don’t have to change my outfit, I can I do it right here, right now. And I did it. I feel a bit better now. I feel like I have to do your workouts more often. Your calming voice, but yet alive and funny really are medicine to me. Thank you Adrien from the bottom of my heart.

Hi there!  If you're reading this and you happen to be new to this journey, I just wanna let you know that today was the final day of this journey for me.  It has massively changed and helped my flexibility, my back and my breathing.  It was worth every single day to get onto the mat and start the video.  The journey coming to an end for me was quite sad cos I get attached to routines very quickly, but if you're thinking of doing this then I highly recommend it!  Thank you Adriene for helping me find a love for Yoga.  And for any newcomers still reading this, don't give up!  You'll get to the final day and thank yourself whilst beaming with pride and maybe feeling a little sad that it's all over.

the ending made me cry for some reason, it was so sweet! I'm very stiff and even doing downward dog was a struggle for my calf but I did it! super excited to see the improvements I'll be having, hopefully less stiff! thank you so much for this ❤️

So this video is 2 years old but my mom(54 with a bad back and hip) and I (22 and a bit overweight with anxiety) decided to do this challenge during quarantine. We have done it twice in a row now. My mom has been the most flexible in years and I am handling my anxiety so much better now along with losing some weight. Today was suppose to be our break before trying the new shift program. However, after a bad day at work I knew I needed some yoga. My mom and I are addicted now, can’t go a day without getting on the mat. Thank you Adriene. With your encouragement and welcoming nature two new yogi start their journey. For anyone reading this, take a few minutes of your day to care for your mind and body, it’s worth it I promise,

I have just completed the 30 day challenge.  I am 67 years old and when I started my right hip would not go down in the cross legged position due to arthritis...it does now,  I also could not make the transition from plank to cobra without collapsing onto my knees first whic is a breeze now.   
thank you Adriene I really enjoyed it and will continue with you.

Last year I moved out of state to live with my grandma, after a series of unfortunate events which led me to be homeless(caused by me, no excuses) and for awhile I was doing nothing but moping and drinking and laying in bed on my laptop in the basement... my knees were literally crackling and popping every time I would stand up or bend down.  Sometimes there would even be an excruciating pain that would shoot into my left knee when I would just be standing still.  A few times in the middle of the night I would wake up with a sharp pain in my back from my bad posture. I wasn't overweight or anything, but being depressed and sitting around all day was literally destroying my body.  For the first time In my life I was starting to suffer from panic attacks from all the alcohol and stress and the occasional drug use.  The girl I was seeing at the time who I was in a long distant relationship from the state I moved from broke up with me one night...she was the love of my life and my only friend I had left in the world... I literally lost all hope.  That very same night after coming home from the bar drunk and seeing the breakup message, I just typed in "yoga" on youtube, in a last ditch effort to basically save my life.  Up popped this video... 30 day yoga challenge.    I remember Doing "day 1" while still drunk and tears still running down my face.  To be honest it sucked, my feet, wrists, knees, neck, back, shoulders, all hurt while following along.. But I did it.  I stuck with it.  I have done the challenge twice, and now I'm doing it a third time.  I feel so amazing.  So amazing that I felt the need to leave this comment.  As corny as it sounds.. I strongly believe your videos saved me from a pit of despair that I probably would have never gotten out of if I didn't change.  Anyways.. Namaste :)

This video has changed my life. I started just a little over a month ago. It took me a week to make it from start to finish in 1 session. I would start from the beginning every morning and ever night. I got inspired and changed my diet. By week two, I was able to do the full video twice a day. I went from 126 to 111 lbs. I am healthier and stronger than I have ever been at 33 years old. I have friends coming over to share the video and start their journey too. I can touch my toes and I am beginning to see definition in my arms and abs. Thank you Adrienne, for making me a healthier mom, wife, and dental hygienist.

When I consider all the tutorials I follow to learn poses such as Bakasana, and all the scaffolding necessary, I am amazed at the assumptions reflected in this video about what people can do as beginners of the practice with a few instructions that actually rely on months and months of strength/flexibility  building, proprioception and general body awareness. Like teaching algebra to people still learning basic calculations. She should just start by saying this is a level 2 and higher session. It can take years to develop the kind of core it takes to hop up as she does, being sure to focus on knees to chest as opposed to flipping up feet, which many newbies will do. Just offer some level 1 videos as well as these advanced ones so people don't hurt themselves.

Dear Kassandra, Thank you.

The last thing you want to do is force a stretch of the cervical spine by pulling the head to one side with your hand. Muscles don't stretch, they contract on one side of the bones, and relax on the other side. With a lateral "stretch" of the neck, both sides are in contraction, one side contracting more than the other. Just breathe and allow the head to tilt to one side, don't force it.

Today I felt one coming on, and I immediately grabbed my mat and went outside to do this practice. Words cannot express how much it helped. It helped clear my mind, gave me that rush of endorphins that my body so desperately needs, and it gave me hope for handling my anxiety and panic attacks through yoga. Thank you, Adrienne.

I have been struggling with my severe anxiety for months now and I'm even on medication and nothing could help me calm down. I'm no longer in fear of my anxiety. Thank you so much Adriene.

Fastest relief for strong tension i've had building up for about a year.  The more I focused on it , it got progressively worse. this helped me not only to deeply knead out the muscle tissue and relax it, but also to pivot my focus onto releasing  mentally which in turn also helps physically.  Any time I tried to deal with my predicament, it resulted in maybe a little relief sometimes, but usually just more tightening. It was a vicious cycle. By the time I found this I was at a point where I was lucky if I got a whole day without tightening and locking up. And, if I did get a day without it, i could still feel a little soreness from the last episode. Every time that soreness would eventually lead back into the cycle by night time. So I can not stress enough how helpful this video was!!!!!! And how important it is to tune into our own bodies and awareness. Something so simple and relaxing, in the span of 14min, has singnificantly affected my life for the better. thank you.
